intro: Lysimachia rosthorniana, commonly known as the Alpine yellow loosestrife, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in cymes. Lysimachia rosthorniana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens or alpine settings.
